outputs.name: rooms
outputs.description: The input Rooms with their load values modified.

inputs.name: _rooms
inputs.description:
Honeybee Rooms to which the input load values should be assigned.
This can also be a Honeybee Model for which all Rooms will be
assigned the loads.

inputs.name: person_count_
inputs.description: A number for the quantity of people in the room.

inputs.name: lighting_watts_
inputs.description: A number for the installed wattage of lighting in the room (W).

inputs.name: electric_watts_
inputs.description:
A number for the installed wattage of electric equipment
in the room (W).

inputs.name: gas_watts_
inputs.description: A number for the installed wattage of gas equipment in the room (W).

inputs.name: hot_wtr_flow_
inputs.description:
Number for the peak flow rate of service hot water in the
room in liters per hour (L/h).

inputs.name: infiltration_ach_
inputs.description:
A number for the infiltration flow rate in air changes
per hour (ACH).

inputs.name: vent_flow_
inputs.description:
A numerical value for the absolute of flow of outdoor air ventilation
for the room in cubic meters per second (m3/s). Note that inputting
a value here will overwrite all specification of outdoor air ventilation
currently on the room (per_floor, per_person, ach).

name: HB Apply Abolute Load Values
description:
Apply absolute load values to Rooms.
_
Note that, while the assigned load values are absolute, this component will convert
them to the "normalized" value for each room (eg. lighting per floor area) in
order to apply them to the rooms. So any existing specification of load intensity
is overwritten with the absolute load here.
_
This also means that, if a room has no floors (or exterior walls for infiltration),
the resulting load values will be equal to 0 regardless of the input here. The
only exception is the vent_flow_, which will be applied regardless of the room
properties.
_
This component will not edit any of the schedules or other properties associated
with each load value. If no schedule currently exists to describe how the load
varies over the simulation, the "Always On" schedule will be used as a default.
-
